Articles.Content:
Ok, I've just finished the first part of filming. And speaking of Star Citizen... wouldn't you say the version of Mission Controller's fighter killer, modified exclusively for this video, is looking a little bit like the Aurora?

And I can't wait until I get to see some of these interiors. More people should do it

Ok, I've just finished the first part of filming. And speaking of Star Citizen... wouldn't you say the version of Mission Controller's fighter killer, modified exclusively for this video, is looking a little bit like the Aurora?

http://i.imgur.com/ACF9XGJ.png

And I can't wait until I get to see some of these interiors. More people should do it

I like the way that Ship looks. Is it going to be in the B9 Battlestar cinematic, or episode 19 of KS?
It's going to be in the cinematic, you know that there's no way I would allow that much weaponry in KS xD

Yeah, I kinda figured that

Edit: Is the cinematic going to be multiple episodes, or just one thing?

Another edit: You may want to check out this mod for KS to give veteran Kerbals some distinction: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/67246-0-23-5-Final-Frontier-kerbal-individual-merits-0-3-15

Edited September 6, 2014 by MissionController3134

Yeah, I kinda figured that

Edit: Is the cinematic going to be multiple episodes, or just one thing?

Just the one off, maybe another one down the road if people like it.
Sounds good

Lol, does my Reaper class carrier get to be in the cinematic? I can modify the ASF-50s to be more BD Dakka heavy.

Edited September 7, 2014 by 2SPOOKY4U

To keep up with demand for orbital transport vehicles, daeCorp has initiated a new project. The first in a new line of pure transport ships is the Cachalot-class [sNCV-60] Freighter.

The Cachalot is built for increased comfourt for its crew of three, with a roomy bridge and a common dining area between the private sleeping cabins. The large cargo bay is equipped with a pair of powerful gripping claws for carrying any sort of cargo. A large door on the rear can open to allow very large items inside and close again to protect the crew and cargo from space junk and weapons fire. A smaller door opens from the front of the cargo bay underneath the bridge for easy crew access (4 key). As with all of daeCorp's large ships, the Cachalot comes with an interplanetary transceiver, high-efficiency NERVA engines, and stylish wing-shaped radiators to expel heat from the massive hauling engines.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Craft File

Edited September 7, 2014 by daemonCaptrix

Lol, does my Reaper class carrier get to be in the cinematic? I can modify the ASF-50s to be more BD Dakka heavy.

Sorry man, but I've already got a decent way into filming it. And the battlefield is already 2000+ parts; I'm having to use a whole lot of film magic to get rid of the lag as it is.

To keep up with demand for orbital transport vehicles, daeCorp has initiated a new project. The first in a new line of pure transport ships is the Cachalot-class [sNCV-60] Freighter.

The Cachalot is built for increased comfourt for its crew of three, with a roomy bridge and a common dining area between the private sleeping cabins. The large cargo bay is equipped with a pair of powerful gripping claws for carrying any sort of cargo. A large door on the rear can open to allow very large items inside and close again to protect the crew and cargo from space junk and weapons fire. A smaller door opens from the front of the cargo bay underneath the bridge for easy crew access (4 key). As with all of daeCorp's large ships, the Cachalot comes with an interplanetary transceiver, high-efficiency NERVA engines, and stylish wing-shaped radiators to expel heat from the massive hauling engines.

That ship looks amazing, and the interior is great. It does look very much like it were from Star Citizen, especially with those engines. Probably some of the best aesthetics I've ever seen on a ship in KSP

Edited September 7, 2014 by HatBat
Have I made it into the cinematic?

Sorry, all the ships that I'm using are in this album. They are ordered as BattleStar then the fighter belonging to it for the three groups: the MU, UKN and UKSN. I'm not choosing favourites here, it's just all the BattleStars that have been submitted and the relevant fighter that the builder has provided.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Yeah, HatBat, I realized my little fighter didn't have the proper docking ports for the Battle Star. At least I don't think it does.

Edited September 7, 2014 by MissionController3134

Well, I made modifications to the BattleStar and the fighters to make sure everything was compatible, I just really like the aesthetics of the larger one. This is how I have it docked by the way (using ports on the sides of the engine nacelles).

Sorry, all the ships that I'm using are in this album. They are ordered as BattleStar then the fighter belonging to it for the three groups: the MU, UKN and UKSN. I'm not choosing favourites here, it's just all the BattleStars that have been submitted and the relevant fighter that the builder has provided.

Just think about it this way y'all. The ships he is not using are just that good that he wants to save them for his KS series

Very true

If you didn't notice, it's SP+ counterpart is now in the album.

Dat damage though. Straight through the hitchhikers at a slight angle skinning the fighter and removing the cupola.

The overdrive continues...

A lot of these are pretty much done I'm just too lazy and scared of unknown issues to put them out there(Like the carriers which couldn't let the kerbals out until I fixed that just now)

EDIT: I think I figured out why I like it so much. It looks angry.

Edited September 8, 2014 by Spartwo
I am so hyped for this cinematic I keep checking this page for a video or an update like every 2 minutes

Ok, I'm doing pretty good. What's taken me so long is a warp effect, so there's no progress on the actual battle. What I'm in need of is some help, there's something that needs my immediate attention at the moment and anybody who's got the time to set up the relevant ships in a 10k orbit around Eeloo (Hyper edit allowed, naturally ) would have my utmost gratitude. It would mean we can get the video out much faster than otherwise. I'll PM you the details and the modified ships if you think you're up for it.

(Did I mention you'll be in the credits and get to see everything I've completed up to this point, early )
